t/commit/6d16a658e5ebe6ce15856565a47090d5b9d5dfb6

https://

63
…)

No matter how many instructions/prompts I give, I cant get Clawdbot to be as proactive as yours. 

It just waits for my instructions unless I specifically schedule something. 

Even after going over this oversight with Clawdbot, it admits it was wrong, but goes right back to
Should’ve renamed clawdbot to mr pinchy…

Introducing Kimaki: Clawdbot for teams, built on top of opencode & Discord

┣ run `npx kimaki` inside your Mac minis
┣ install it in as many computers as you want
┣ control a swarm of bots inside Discord
┗ collaborate with agents & team mates

Link with tutorial:  

https://
medium.com/@gemQueenx/cla
wdbot-ai-installation-guide-usage-tutorial-real-world-use-cases-and-expert-tips-tricks-81fc03228a22
…

And it's a "simple command" that should install in 5 minutes :-) 

npm install -g clawdbot@latest

But I'm still in the phase of installing dependencies and currently on the latest version of Fedora (the 42).
